narratives.question_text: What was valuable about this class, either in format or content?
comments: Everything related to sound engineer prospective. The Handover on every class is very helpful.

The class served as a good "catch-all" in regards to basic sound equipment and technical concepts as well as the requisite paperwork to document a sound design. The technical investigations (amps, speakers, etc.) were especially helpful to investigate and explain terminology that incoming students may take for granted (total harmonic distortion, true diversity, array theory...) but lack a thorough understanding of. It was extremely useful to see not only the instructor's approach to paperwork, but also my peers' paperwork. Seeing a variety of organizational styles was helpful in prompting me to reconsider the effectiveness of my own organizational systems.

narratives.question_text: Are there adjustments, additions or deletions that might be beneficial?
comments: I honestly can't think of any.

narratives.question_text: Were there any particular challenges that were difficult to overcome?
Do you have any comments about the teaching/learning environment?
comments: It's a relatively small class so everybody could get good information. If one is left behind the teacher will stop and help, which is very helpful to ones personal comprehension.

I really appreciated that the small class size and David's flexibility allowed us to investigate the topics we were most interested in. I always felt like I could ask questions and would receive thorough answers.

narratives.question_text: Please provide any other constructive comments below.
